pr_title: Cosmos: CFP and Permission fixes and code refactoring

timeline.message: Add checks on the lease container client context to ensure that content response on write is enabled and warn if consistency level is lesser than SESSION.
Update Cosmos permission properties and replace setResourceLink() APIs. Added APIs require passing the container name and optionally the child resource for which the permissions will be granted.
Fix for spot-bug issue and extend create test to capture the new permission properties APIs.

timeline.bodyText: All of these instance variables should be private
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: I thought we need to throw error in this case, as CFP will not work in consistency below SESSION, no ?
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: I think we should fail on these cases, logs may go unnoticed by user
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: The CFP should continue to work with lesser than SESSION consistency level; the downside of it is that lease documents might not be updated in a timely fashion by the current CFP instance in certain conditions which at worst can lead to documents being seen more than once. SESSION or better will help avoid that because once the lease document is written, the CFP instance will have it right away in most scenarios across all its workers.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.author: kushagraThapar

+/**
+ * Specifies the kind of resource that has a Cosmos container as parent resource.
+ */
+public enum CosmosContainerChildResourceKind {

replies.bodyText: The naming seems a bit odd to me. why can't we use the existing CosmosResourceType?
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
CosmosResourceType is "implementation" and it also includes more resource types than what is applicable to creating a Permission object.
I renamed the class however to ContainerChildResourceType.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: Is the reason for this is because permission can only be initialized when we get response from backend?
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText:
that is why it was removed... the permission local member can only be created via the JSON related constructor.
Empty constructor is still required for create ops scenario.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText:
please use StringUtils.split instead of String.split
String.split uses regex and is not performant
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
this is called setContainerName but in the test .setContainerName("AQAAAJ0fgTc=") uses portion of the selflink.
So is this the container name or just a portion of the selflink?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: it's the container name... I will make a change to make it more obvious; initially I did not want to mess with the test used/expected values.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText:
this is called containerName but in the test .setContainerName("AQAAAJ0fgTc=") uses portion of the selflink.
So is this the container name or just a portion of the selflink?

this is called withPermissionContainerName but in the test . withPermissionContainerName("AQAAAJ0fgTc=") uses portion of the selflink.
So is this the container name or just a portion of the selflink?
ditto

                 .withId(permissionSettings.getId())
                 .withPermissionMode(PermissionMode.READ)
-                .withPermissionResourceLink("dbs/AQAAAA==/colls/AQAAAJ0fgTc=")

timeline.bodyText: can the logic in Utils be used to avoid redoing similar logic here?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: I could not find any... there are Utils APIs that do some of the splitting for a resource path, not applicable for this case though.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText:
How about
PathHelper#generatePathForNameBased()
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/implementation/PathsHelper.java#L30
There are other useful methods there too. can they be used instead of duplicating the logic?
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
generatePathForNameBased(0 an be used to a certain degree but it requires multiple calls and passing it the Resource argument which is not currently available. IMHO the code will look a lot messier and hard to understand.
For the constant/hardcoded names we already used the predefined final strings; we do similar things in Utils for certain type of resources. I think the current implementation has the right balance and it's easy to check what the expected results should look like in case of debugging.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: I think this is intended to have jsonString not "jsonString" ?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: "jsonString" is the name of the argument, not the content...
